intro: Pavetta finlaysoniana, commonly known as the Bornean pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pavetta finlaysoniana is often found in moist, shaded undergrowth and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
